clauses.title: Assignment of Inventions
clauses.body: {{employee_name}} (the 'Employee') agrees that all inventions, discoveries, improvements, works of authorship, and intellectual property (collectively 'Inventions') created during employment with {{company_name}} (the 'Company') are the Company's exclusive property. The Employee assigns all rights, title, and interest in such Inventions to the Company.

clauses.title: Scope of Assignment
clauses.body: This assignment covers Inventions that: (1) relate to the Company's current or anticipated business, (2) result from work performed for the Company, or (3) are developed using Company time, equipment, or resources. This applies whether created alone or with others, during or outside normal working hours.

clauses.title: California Labor Code Exception
clauses.body: Under California Labor Code Section 2870, this Agreement does not apply to Inventions that: (1) are developed entirely on the Employee's own time, (2) without using Company equipment, supplies, or trade secrets, (3) do not relate to the Company's business or research, and (4) do not result from work performed for the Company. The Employee should disclose such inventions to ensure proper classification.

clauses.title: Prior Inventions
clauses.body: The Employee has disclosed all prior inventions in Exhibit A (if none, write 'None'). Prior inventions remain the Employee's property but may not be used in Company work without written agreement. The Employee represents that their work for the Company will not violate any obligations to previous employers.

clauses.title: Disclosure Obligation
clauses.body: The Employee will promptly disclose all Inventions to the Company in writing. This allows the Company to determine ownership and take appropriate steps to protect its intellectual property rights. Failure to disclose may result in loss of rights or disciplinary action.

clauses.title: Assistance with Protection
clauses.body: The Employee agrees to assist the Company in protecting its intellectual property rights, including signing patent applications, copyright registrations, or other documents. This obligation continues after employment ends. The Company will reimburse reasonable expenses for such assistance.

clauses.title: Waiver of Moral Rights
clauses.body: To the extent permitted by law, the Employee waives all moral rights in Inventions assigned to the Company. This includes rights of attribution and integrity. The Company may use, modify, or commercialize Inventions without restriction.

clauses.title: Works Made for Hire
clauses.body: To the extent any Inventions qualify as 'works made for hire' under copyright law, they are the Company's property from creation. This Agreement serves as confirmation and assignment of any rights that may not automatically belong to the Company.

clauses.title: Governing Law
clauses.body: This Agreement is governed by California law, including California Labor Code Section 2870. Any disputes will be resolved in California courts.

clauses.title: Signatures
clauses.body:
By signing below, the Employee acknowledges understanding and agreeing to this IP & Invention Assignment Agreement.

Employee: _________________ Date: _______

Exhibit A - Prior Inventions: _________________ (or 'None')
